titleStmt.title: An outragious out--cry for tithes, and a deep charge of stealing, cheating, robbing, &c. for not paying of them (contained in nine reasons, sent some few daies since in print to divers) answered.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Henry Hills, and are to be sold at his house in Fleet-yard next door to the Rose and Crown, and by William Larnar at the Blackmoor at Fleet-Bridge,

notesStmt.note: A reply to: The dreadfull danger of sacriledge in the with-holding of tithes.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his house in Fleet-yard next door to the Rose
